text: :wave: howdy all!

<@UBXEU90UQ> $welcome
i read from the previous one, cheers though :smile:
gotta delete and resubmit a msg when you correct it for the word expansion to work :slightly_smiling_face:
thousand thumbs-up for DR btw - running like 2 commands to get PXE boot working compared to our live setup (foreman) is a breath of fresh air, haha

i do have a quick Q - in the ‘machines’ list if i click on show, all of the fields (RAM, NICs, CPUs etc) show no inventory / data - but the machines are in the discovery image, have run gohai and show the relevant info in there - am I missing something, does that info come from somewhere else?

<@UBXEU90UQ> the "inventory" data you are referring to are from a separate "inventory" piece - you need to (optionally customize the inventory), and run the Inventory stage in a workflow on the machines
there are 2 levels of inventory - the "gohai-inventory" which produces extremely detailed machine information - but is hard to parse and manage for classification efforts and for SKU validation
the second is the basic "inventory" which creates a simplified (customizable) flat list of the "things that matter to you"

you can view a video related to using the Inventory and validation pieces, at: 
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xDqxEW5bgiQ&t=553s>

attachments.title: Digital Rebar Inventory Stage (RackN Task-Library)
attachments.fallback: YouTube Video: Digital Rebar Inventory Stage (RackN Task-Library)

we realized that this would happen yesterday and are thinking about ways to fix it

Regarding ESXi installation, everything goes well. The only thing is after installation, the machine's status is labeled "not set" instead of "complete", and terraform does not report that machines have completed the workflow.  Even though I have added the "complete" stage at the end of the workflow? any thoughts about this?
<@UBBSHF675> the ESXi environment cannot run a runner.  I think this is discussed about 2 weeks back in this channel
Hmm - it does point out that we may want have that done step sent something we do track.  hmm
